ETYMOLOGY: From Modern Latin electricus ('of amber'), derived from Ancient Greek ḗlektron ('amber'), referring to the static electricity produced when amber is rubbed.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adj means adjective, modifying a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or operated by electricity; powered by current.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 关于电的；用电操作的；通电的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The city is planning to replace all gasoline vehicles with electric buses.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这座城市计划用电动公交车取代所有燃油车辆。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adj means adjective, modifying a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Very exciting, thrilling, or highly charged with emotion or tension.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 激动人心的；令人兴奋的；充满活力的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The atmosphere at the concert was electric; the crowd roared every time the band changed songs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 音乐会的气氛非常热烈；乐队每换一首歌，人群都会发出吼叫声。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n means noun, usually used in the plural.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Usually plural) The electrical components, system, or wiring in a vehicle or building.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （通常为复数）电气系统；线路；电子元件。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We had to rewire the electrics completely because the house was so old.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 因为房子太旧了，我们不得不彻底重新布置电路系统。
